EVAN: Thatâ€™s a very good question. Thankfully, CoreBluetooth is an abstraction overall of that â€“ the Bluetooth stuff that is going on under the hood. So in that respect, itâ€™s very nice for us to work with us app developers. And it kind of boils down to just a few kinds of basic processes. [Chuckles]

So each device, itâ€™s not only just the device itself; what it does is it exposes some services. And the services then have these things called characteristics. So you have a couple of levels of things here. First is discovering the device itself. Whatâ€™s interesting about CoreBluetooth is since you could have literally an ocean of devices surrounding you, one thing you can do about CoreBluetooth is, say, show me all the devices that support this, for instance, a thermometer service. Or it can even be a proprietary â€“ there are certain set of standard services that you can search for that the Bluetooth, especially [inaudible] has actually created and those standard ones like heart rate monitorâ€™s one of those, but then you can also create your own.

So from your appâ€™s perspective, you can tell CoreBluetooth, â€œFind me all of the devices in the area that support this thermometer function,â€ and it will go and itâ€™ll look and itâ€™ll return you an array of these things. Then you either take the first one off the stack or you can say, â€œHeyâ€“â€œ or maybe you do some â€“ a little bit more inspection. And then you say, â€œOkay, thatâ€™s the oneâ€ and then you can connect to it and say, â€œTell me what all your services are that you support.â€ Then it gives you the full [inaudible] because when itâ€™s in the broadcast mode, it will just say â€“ itâ€™ll give you a limited number of them. It could if it has a limited number of services. So when you get into doing is â€“ then you do some introspection with the device. Iâ€™m simplifying things a bit but thatâ€™s how it works and thereâ€™s a lot of looping [chuckles]. Thatâ€™s pretty much all there is to it. Thereâ€™s probably more complex scenarios but in the basics, thatâ€™s what it is. You can also write to those characteristics, too. And in some cases, this his helpful.
